author: Staff Reporter
text:
T. Thilakavathy (35) of Senthil Nagar in Somanur, near Karumathampatty, reportedly ended her life on Monday by consuming poison. She was upset as she had lost over Rs. 10 lakh in a multi level marketing scam.

It is learnt that about four years ago she, and her husband Thirunavukarasu (40) who runs a bakery at Somanur, borrowed money from a few persons and invested it in the firm. But, the firm closed down. The scam is being investigated by the Economic Offences Wing Police.

The police said that there were allegations that the money was not invested in the firm but was used to establish the bakery. Thilakavathy was alone at home after her daughters Gomathy (15) and Ramya (11) left for their grandparent’s house in Tirupur on Saturday, and Thirunavukarasu left for Madurai on Sunday. Her relative Prabakaran (20) who paid a visit to the house later that day saw her lying unconscious. He took her to Coimbatore Medical College Hospital.

But the doctors declared her as brought dead.
title: Scam fallout: woman ends life
